text:
I understand scenario when you want to prevent re-subscribing if customers _doesn’t_ want to get any e-mail (and _*someone else*_ tries to re-subscribe given e-mail). Fair enough.

But what about when _*customer*_ changes their mind and wants to re-subscribe?

It’s not a bug, it’s missing feature then!

Basically, we want to allow customer to control their subscription preferences via _our_ app (integrated with HubSpot via API). There is no way to achieve that if your API prevents controlling. How customer can re-subscribe without using e-mail (imagine that they already deleted all marketing e-mails)?

One obvious solution is to go directly to manage preferences URL  - there is even an idea posted but hasn’t got any attention for the past almost 5 years!
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Generate-the-URL-for-a-specific-contact-to-access-the/idi-p/22909>
Thus… without HubSpot API and without that URL - how can customer re-subscribe?

You need to enable the Resubscription email on Settings -> Marketing -> Email, when a contact that has unsubscribed try to submit a form with their email address, a message will appear, something like "looks like this email has unsubscribed to all our email, do you want to re-subscribe?", clicking that link will trigger the resubscription email that allows them to resubscribe again
What is the form you’re talking about? How customer can access it? Does this need to be manually for each customer?
I enabled Resubscription email but I honestly don’t see any difference and I still don’t know how to re-subscribe other than going to Manage Preferences page from previous e-mail.
that message will appear in every HubSpot form, take a look here <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/email/resubscribe-contacts-to-your-marketing-emails>
I’ve already seen and checked this page. It’s extremely disappointing and the whole “problem” seems to be originating from the fact you are not willing to give a link to Manage Preferences page.

Simple solution via Marketing API would be:
• enable re-subscription e-mail
• when you get a call to Marketing API’s then instead of throwing an error `cannot be updated because they have unsubscribed` you should trigger the re-subscription e-mail (if you really need to do this via e-mail)

The other obvious and simple solution is to give a way to either retrieve or generate URL as in the idea I referenced earlier (which I assume is not going to happen as the idea is 5 years old now and it’s status is: *not currently planned*). Very disappointing.

I do agree that HubSpot could be doing better with this.

Does the resubscription email setting with HubSpot forms work with custom forms that may be using the API? Because if not then that doesn't help for those using their own forms.
Do you happen to have any code samples you are willing to share?
having a css `gap` property on dnd rows should be a must
Would you say this is … gap … in our offerings?
